(U) Data-Driven Tactical Resupply at the Infantry's Edge
Bob Forrester, DEVCOM-AC, Eric Campagna, DEVCOM SC TBD
(U) Data-driven sustainment system supporting agile infantry operations
(U) On-weapon sensors, data aggregation/visualization Nett Warrior, TOC decision aids
(U) Data capabilities to meet future Predictive Logistics needs for Infantry
(U) Definitive interface standards to standardized data requirements & interoperability
(U) Delivery interoperability, monitoring, and automatic notifications
(U) Leave behind: Integrated system enabling data-driven sustainment of dismount infantry units and tasking of distribution assets
(U) Integrated Systems providing complete tactical resupply OODA loop:
(U) O bserve consumption via sensors on weapons
(U) O rient on the data with visualization and contextual information

End-to-end data driven resupply capability from data generation to delivery
Coordinating and tasking resupply delivery technologies based on demand signals and future requirements
AmmoSAN Integrates various disparate/ standalone efforts into a reliable and operationally effective capability, resulting in:
Cl-V (ammo) supply data and resupply demand data aggregation
Pre-flight resupply planning, coordination, and tasking
Automatic long range / 'Last Tactical Leg' resupply execution:
 Optimized target selection based on vehicle capability & environment
 Optimized target selection based the unit's route/pace
 Automatic resupply vehicle selection and preflight data sourcing & distribution
 Digital supply manifesting and vehicle tasking
 Automatic resupply event detection, notification, and retasking (for mission failure)
Shared resupply mission profile (sustainment & tactical unit)
Preconfigure communication network at field level
Interoperability with CBIM and transmits to higher echelons
Simplify request via preconfigured parameters/supply assemblies (i.e. speedballs)
Close out mission and reset supply on hand via strike report

1.Armament and Ammunition Data Driven Expeditionary Resupply (AADDER) : DEVCOM AC proof of concept/benchtop demonstration showing viability of Class-V consumption driven decision making for resupply, advanced manufacturing, and predicted logistics.
2.Small Unit Resupply (SUR) Information Exchange : Digitalizes the resupply request and pre-flight coordination across multiple sustainment personnel/organizations.
3.SUR Supply/Consumption Initiated Resupply : Automatically initiates a resupply based on manual reporting, real-time monitoring, and all-echelon of supply level data aggregation.

4.SUR Decision Dominance : Accelerates reply planning thought automation.  Automates resupply vehicle selection based on vehicle availability and mission suitability, monitors and adapts to failure during mission execution, and allows caching of supply in route at time of need.
5.Automatic Landing Zone (Auto-LZ) : Automates Drop Zone/Landing Zone selection based on vehicle performance models and digital environment around point of need.
6.Preflight Resupply Data Processing and Distribution : Automates resupply mission data sourcing, aggregation, processing, and distribution for autonomous resupply systems.

7.PITSTOP - Provide ability to report supplies manually, aggregate the data with consumption sensors up the chain of command, facilitate field level cross leveling, and provide a field level map-based supply database that links up CL-III consumers and providers.
8.AmmoSAN : Integration effort of various disparate projects into a reliable and operationally effective capability.
1.ARC M4 & M-270 : On weapon sensor detecting consumption.
2.TAMMS : At-echelon perspective of ammunition posture across multiple formations, managing demand signal and response, linked into TDP.
3.CLESM : Provides 'digital twin' concept of weapon systems to feed armament system management and readiness. Discrete AI decision functionality across nested / linked operational nodes
*Complimentary Investment from PEO Soldier: (Sensors on M249 Machine Gun)
Purpose: Automates and Streamlines the resupply process
Facilitate rapid/accurate decision making based on real time data from the tactical edge
Increase reliability by selecting the right vehicle for the mission
Streamline the resupply process through automation
Provide sustainment situational awareness between echelons
Enable predicted logistics using real time data
Sustainment Support Network for Autonomous Aerial Resupply Vehicles (SNAARV)

PROBLEM/ISSUE :  Current aerial resupply infrastructure lacks the ability to source, process, and distribute flight data to vehicles for mission planning and execution. Data sourcing and distribution rely on a network of highly trained and expensive Field Service Representatives to manually download data on a per mission basis from multiple independent sources, process and synthesis with additional data on a unique mission planning computer and prepared for vehicle transfer. Additionally,  the next generation of guided aerial  resupply vehicles are targeting significantly longer ranges and flight times which will  require much more information prior to and potentially during flight.
USTRANSCOM FY25 Challenge Ready Now and in the Future - Rapid Distribution Technologies focus area as it autonomously facilitates end-to-end flow of military equipment and cargo.

USTRANSCOM FY25 Challenge Create Decision Advantage - Big Data focus area given that the infrastructure to be developed will enable data discovery and predictive/prescriptive analytics. List the gaps/challenges/documentation for requirement traceability

The Joint Concept for Contested Logistics (JCCL) is a Joint Warfighting Concept which is derived from the National Defense Strategy and outlines Resilient Logistics as 'the ability to project and protect access to critical joint logistics material, assets, infrastructure, …, and networks from the point of origin to the point of need…' related to sustainment for distributed operations.

RATIONALE: This proposal will leverage existing government owned, disconnected servers and applications to develop an integrated solution that automatically sources, processes, synthesizes, and distributes data to the following autonomous aerial resupply vehicles

PROGRAM OF RECORD: US Army PM FSS JPADS 2klb Program of Record with strong linkages are to the USAF CAT Program of Record and the Special Operations Mission Planning and Execution for integration with currently available systems.

VALUE ADDED/ROI: Provide a streamlined, automated pipeline of mission critical data enabling faster response times to real-time logistics needs, reducing timeconsuming manual decision making and processes.

Sustainment Support Network for Autonomous Aerial Resupply Vehicles (SNAARV)
Objectives : Develop a centralized server that sources, processes, synthesizes, and distributes resupply data to field level mission planning systems and resupply vehicles.
 defines the AO based on bandwidth
 distributes data to mission planning equipment
 uses it for preflight mission planning applications
 Broadcasts data wirelessly to resupply vehicles and verifies receipt

Future Contested Logistics battlefields will require a various resupply vehicles and domains to counter the adversary's dynamic and evolving threats.  The availability and access to various resupply vehicles places an impossible training burden on the force, since no single person/office will be sufficiently trained on the performance specifications of each air vehicle and be capable to selecting the appropriate Landing Zone (LZ) or Drop Zone (DZ).

will aid in the selection of a LZ or DZ by presenting the user with a map-based course of action decision tool, at the point of need. The tool will identify and highlight potential LZs/DZs for use, given the performance specifications, limitations, and the flight model of the air vehicle.

Addresses the United States Transportation Command (USTRANSCOM) Joint Deployment & Distribution Enterprise (JDDE) Challenges Create Decision Advantage Risk Assessment and Ready Now and in the Future - Delivery Technologies through automation of LZ/DZ selection and risk assessment, enablement of automatic emergency landing, and supporting of mission planning.

Capability Development Document (CDD) for Autonomous Aerial Distribution, 30 April 2020, documents required system attributes for autonomous resupply vehicles of the future. This document includes Key System Attributes (KSA) such as Emergency Landing capability while in route  and the ability to conduct autonomous landing in a cleared area.
Joint Concept for Contested Logistics (JCCL), document outlines the critical need to reduce/eliminate manual decision making within logistics/resupply process that supports the tactical edge.
Demonstrate ability to automatically select DZ/LZ locations for various aerial resupply and insertion based on performance data, environment, terrain, and obstacles.
U.S. Army Airdrop Mission Planning Website USAF Consolidated Airdrop Tool (CAT) Program of Record Net Warrior
Reduce collateral damage and Airdrop Damage Estimate (ADE) risk
Situational awareness of potential DZ/LZ locations, reduced time to decision

Process data layers and void locations based on Vehicle Constraints
 Surface will not allow for recovery

Result: Map & database presenting possible Drop Zones & Landing Zones.

PROBLEM/ISSUE: The joint services currently lack the ability to support and manage largescale, high pace distributed operations in the Contested Logistics (CL) environment, where logistics systems and support personnel will need to be flexible and highly adaptive to a mobile and dynamic battlefield. Additionally, Soldiers on the future battlefield will have access to a variety of resupply vehicles to choose from, which presents an impossible training burden to the force; since no single person/decision maker can be sufficiently trained on the performance of all resupply vehicles to determine which vehicle is best suited for a given mission. To overcome these challenges, commanders require an integrated and automated resupply planning and execution system that streamlines and accelerates the responsiveness of emergency aerial resupply by minimizing human in the loop decision making. Observe

Addresses numerous the United States Transportation Command (USTRANSCOM) Joint Deployment & Distribution Enterprise (JDDE) Challenges Create Decision Advantage, specifically End-to-End Visibility and Integrated Common Intelligence Picture.
Joint Concept for Contested Logistics (JCCL), document outlines the critical need to reduce/eliminate manual decision making within logistics/resupply process that supports the tactical edge.

Interoperability with Small Unit Resupply (SUR) is a requirement the AbbreviatedCapability Development Document (A-CDD) for Autonomous Extended Range Aerial Delivery System (AERADS), desired Characteristic (DC) #3, Flight Planning and Mission Planning, and # 4, Autonomy and Mission Command.
Identified as a need in Program Executive Office (PEO) Soldier's Modernization Plan 2024, Project Polaris.
RATIONALE: SUR-DD will accelerate and automate the resupply planning and execution through automation
Automate vehicle selection based on (1) availability and (2) mission suitability.
Automate mission tasking via interoperability with Mission Planning systems.
Monitor & automatically adapt to failure during mission execution
Resupply a moving target by monitoring the dismounted route, location, pace.
Provide theater level situational awareness via a resupply Decision Dashboard.
PROGRAM OF RECORD: Program Executive Office (PEO) Soldier Product Manager (PdM) Nett Warrior
Accelerate response-time & minimize support personnel through decision making.
Increases the mission reliability via data driven decisions.
Decreases the training needed for informed decision making.
Objective: Accelerate resupply planning and execution through automation.
Create/manage geolocated vehicle inventory and monitor current/future usage
Automate resupply vehicle selection based on availability and mission suitability (eg weight/volume and range)
Integrate vehicle tracker and automatically identify takeoff, successful landing, and/or mission failure.  Notify personnel of events only.
Extract the dismounted unit's route and monitor their current location.
Select resupply date, time, location based on vehicle specifications (flight duration) and dismounted unit's route, pace, and current position; allowing for  mobility by hitting a moving target.
